chapter.title: Remote Installation from a Network Server
chapter.para: For detailed information about installing &sls; from a network server in general, see the &deploy;, Chapter 14, Remote Installation (&docaddress;).
The following section provides a short description about installing from a network server.

sect1.title: Installing with Installation Media from the Network

step.para: Copy the &sles4sap; DVD content to a Web server (for example, example.com) to the directory /srv/www/htdocs/sap_repo.
Choose one of the boot menu options and edit the command line:

listitem.para: Remove the parameter instmode=cd from the command line.
To start the network, change netsetup=0 to netsetup=1
Change the parameter autoyast=file:/// to autoyast=http://example.com/sap_repo/.
listitem.remark: Double-check if "netsetup" parameter is correct and not just legacy. See other remark in s4s_autoyast. - sknorr, 2016-01-28

sect1.title: Copying SAP Media Sets from a Remote Server with the Installation Wizard
sect1.para: It is possible to copy the SAP media sets from a remote server (NFS, SMB, etc.). For example, if you want to put the SAP media sets on an NFS Server, proceed as follows:

step.para: Create a directory /srv/www/htdocs/sap_repo on your installation server.
Edit the /etc/exports file on the installation server by adding the following:
In /srv/www/htdocs/sap_repo, create a directory for every SAP media you have, for example kernel, java, maxdb, etc., which will give you a hint about the contents.
step.remark: "Which will give you a hint"? Necessary sentence? - sknorr, 2016-01-29

step.para: Copy the contents of all SAP media with cp -a to the corresponding directory.

tip.title: Avoid Copying on a Windows Operating System
tip.para: Do not copy the media on a Windows operating system because it may break permission settings and capitalization of files and directories.

sect1.para: Now you can install from the NFS server, for example, from example.com:/srv/www/htdocs/sap_repo.
For information about installing &sls; from an NFS server, see the &deploy;, Chapter 14.2, Remote Installation and Section 14.2.2.
